intro: [WRONG START] Illcecebrum filiforme, commonly known as the threadleaf morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It features slender, thread-like leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its seeds are encased in a fleshy, orange-red capsule that splits open when mature. Illecebrum filiforme is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
